title: bugfix for norm_all when tensor size > grain_size, add test case
body_html:
We push our optimization for norm to pytorch master at this PR11565, but we found a bug in norm_all function.
This error maybe cause wrong result if you use this interface on CPU side: a.norm().
The bug could be summarized as this:
sqrt(a1^2+a2^2)+sqrt(a3^2+a4^2) != sqrt(a1^2+a2^2+a3^2+a4^2)

We also add a testcase for this scenario in test/test_torch.py

body:
We push our optimization for norm to pytorch master at this [PR11565](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/11565), but we found a bug in norm_all function.
This error maybe cause wrong result if you use this interface on CPU side: a.norm().
The bug could be summarized as this:
`sqrt(a1^2+a2^2)+sqrt(a3^2+a4^2) != sqrt(a1^2+a2^2+a3^2+a4^2)`

We also add a testcase for this scenario in test/test_torch.py
